title: Dead Society anarchist primitivist Zerzan
description:
Encoded in DrDivx 2.0.1 b7 with Divx codec 6.8 in Home Theater compatibility mode for DIVX certified hardware. Should be compatible in all DIVX certified standalone hardware devices. 
Audio: 128 kb/s MP3 48000Hz Stereo
Video: 850 kb/s divx, 640 x 480
Duration: 55 minutes

Thomas Toivonen&#039;s Dead Society cuts straight to the heart of the situation we?re in right now. The conclusion? We&#039;re fucked! The mass technological culture is killing the planet and if we are to survive, we have to take a look at the roots of the problem. But also avoid false solutions like alternative or ?green? technology. 

The movie centers around an interview with John Zerzan, anarcho-primitivist 
philosopher and author who give his view on the problem with civilization 
and what can be done about it. According to him it?s the reality and 
not ideas that will give way for a paradigm shift. That is, if people are 
provided with an alternative...  In total the film in its 55 minutes 
is a very welcomed addition to the not so large collection of green anarchist films. 

I think as many people as possible should see  it, especially those who are hypnotized by living in the mad machinery of civilization. It&#039;s a slap in the face, an eye opener, a shock; but also inspiring. 
Favorite scenes: riots, making fire with bow-drill,animals jumping...

- Ilmarinen

For more info go to http://www.deadsociety.org	


This movie was filmed by Thomas Toivonen, Vargtassa and Nattsmyg with a digital video camera and two digital cameras in Riddarhyttan, Stockholm and a couple of other places in Sweden.


The movie was edited by Thomas Toivonen on his computer. The footage not filmed by Thomas Toivonen, Vargatassa or Nattsmyg is taken from public domain movies and pictures found on the internet.
